name: Maqāmic Music
description: Originating in the Middle East and founded upon maqāmāt scales, encompassing an extensive and diverse cultural and musical legacy that spans from Morocco to Southeast Asia.

children.name: Arabic Classical Music
children.description: Arabic Classical Music tradition, whose guidelines for modulation, rhythm, and tuning were set down in treatises in the 8th and 9th centuries, based around Maqāmic Music.

children.name: Arabic Classical Music
children.description: Arabic Classical Music tradition, whose guidelines for modulation, rhythm, and tuning were set down in treatises in the 8th and 9th centuries, based around Maqāmic Music.

children.name: Azerbaijani Mugham
children.description: Highly improvisational form of modal music characterized by the singing style and the themes of Azerbaijan’s history.

children.name: Azerbaijani Mugham
children.description: Highly improvisational form of modal music characterized by the singing style and the themes of Azerbaijan’s history.

children.name: Persian Classical Music
children.description: Traditional art music of the Persian civilization.

children.description: Traditional art music of the Persian civilization.

children.name: Shashmaqam
children.description: Modal suite that brings together lyrical and instrumental songs, poetry, and dance shared by Tajik Music and Uzbek Music.

children.name: Shashmaqam
children.description: Modal suite that brings together lyrical and instrumental songs, poetry, and dance shared by Tajik Music and Uzbek Music.

children.name: Sufiana kalam
children.description: Classical music from Kashmir, the northernmost part of the Indian subcontinent.

children.name: Turkish Classical Music
children.description: Classical music of Turkey, which uses the makam modal system, with the primary emphasis often being on the singers, who are accompanied by small ensembles.

children.name: Twelve Muqam
children.description: Uyghur muqam suite of 12 different muqam performances, originating in Southern Xinjiang.
